definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: I had no idea of thescale of things until I went over last year to give readings.
sentences.chinese: 我直到去年去做读书会才知道居然卖了那么多。

sentences.english: It does harm to your eyes reading in the strong light.
sentences.chinese: 在强光下读书会对你的眼睛造成伤害。

sentences.english: Think of it as a permanent, global book club.
sentences.chinese: 你可以将其设想为一个永久性的全球读书会。

sentences.english: Along with a bowling team, Mr. K formed a little book club.
sentences.chinese: 如同组建保龄球队一样，科先生成立了读书会。

sentences.english: K. will participate in a charity book-reading at Radio City Music Hall in New York City.
sentences.chinese: 将在纽约市的城市音乐广播厅参加一个慈善读书会。

sentences.english: How about plan a reading party?
sentences.chinese: 策划一个读书会怎么样？

sentences.english: Reading a book stimulates the imagination.
How about plan a reading party.
sentences.chinese: 筹划一个读书会怎么样？

sentences.english: The book club ladies started asking questions.
sentences.chinese: 读书会的女士们开始有了疑问。

sentences.english: They are all members of our book club.
sentences.chinese: 他们都是我们读书会的成员。

sentences.english: At the meeting also held has majored in engineering the book club tenable ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 会上还举行了学工读书会成立仪式。

sentences.english: Does our reading group need a theme?
sentences.chinese: 我们的读书会需不需要一个主旨？

definition: to read a book/to study/to attend school
teashop with performance by 評書|评书 story tellers/(attached to name of publishing houses)/(in former times) private school/library (of classic texts)
